item.title: Skill cape emotes

@_E1 wrote:

when is use the playerCape == false) I get

client.java:19557: incomparable types: int and boolean
if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == false)
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

and itzkyle, that works when The player is not wearing a cape, but I need one that says to get a skillcape when their wearing a cape (other than a skillcape).

Meh. Nevermind, I created a ghetto way of making it work

item.title: Skill cape emotes
item.dc:creator: @_E1 [E]
item.description:
@_E1 wrote:

blah, heres me problem… Ok I’m adding a custom version of ‘skill cape emotes’ into my server, and I was wondering how to make it so if your not wearing a cape (or a skillcape) then it tells you to get one.

Right now here’s how I got it set up

[code] case ----: // SKILL CAPE EMOTES

		if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == (14094) || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14095)
		{
			stillgfx(gfx, absY+1, absX);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY, absX+1);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY-1, absX);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY, absX-1);
			actionTimer = #;
			sendMessage("You use the HP Skillcape Emote");
			}

		if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == (14088) || playerEquipment[playerCape] == 14089)
		{
			stillgfx(gfx, absY, absX);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY+1, absX);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY, absX+1);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY-1, absX);
			stillgfx(gfx, absY, absX-1);
			actionTimer = #;
			sendMessage("You use the MAGIC Skillcape Emote");
			}

			break;[/code]

I tryed using something like if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == False) { sendMessage("Get a Skillcape before using this emote"); }

but that didnt work… Something about an int and a boolean, Too tired to remember. Anyways back to the point, how can I make it so if the player isint wearing a skillcape it tells them to get one?

Thanks…

Read full topic
